Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not after); 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before)
Name: Andirons
Description: A set of five elements, most likely used as supports for vessels in hearths. The clay is crude, smoothened and unevenly fired - therefore varying from orange to black-grey in colour. Four are vertical supports, conical and topped by a small cupule. The fifth one is bent and has a flat surface. Installed in open hearths, cooking pots would be placed on them.
